response: narrative=Damian Clark, whose family had noticed signs of distress and suicidal ideation, went missing from his home on North Road, Insch. A concerned friend, Shaun, reported Damian’s absence when he failed to show up at a local church meeting. Subsequent inquiries led searchers to focus on nearby areas including the dock/marina. Thankfully, Damian was traced on Bog Road by staff, who provided immediate support and ensured his safe return.

narrative=Damian Clark was last seen at his familiar workplace, a small studio he frequented to recreate art despite his retirement. Known for his tendency to live off-grid, Damian occasionally took solitary retreats without informing anyone. On this occasion, he left a cryptic note hinting at plans to visit 14 East Park, Inchmarlo, and later, a dock in the region, possibly to gather inspiration from nature. Worrisome were his recent remarks on feeling burdensome, suggesting suicidal ideation. Investigators tracked his path from a cemetery near 10 East Cathcart Street to a marina, raising alarms on his whereabouts. Thankfully, Damian was eventually found safe by police at Carmelite Street, Banff.

narrative=Damian Clark, a retired artist, was reported missing after being last seen leaving his workplace near North Road, Insch. He had been active on social media before vanishing, expressing concerns linked with suicidal ideation. His sister, Gail Blackburn, noted that his recent visits to a cemetery on North Lane, Archiestown, for solitude were unusual. MP was eventually found safe by staff at a nearby location after a coordinated search resolved his disappearance.

narrative=Damin Clark was last seen leaving his home at 37 North High Street, AB45 2PA. Known for his quiet demeanor, his family expressed concern over his recent display of suicidal ideation. He had become more active on social media, posting messages that alluded to a substantial internal struggle. Witnesses reported seeing Clark in the vicinity of a cemetery, perhaps seeking solace. With his regular hangout being a workplace wherein his artistic contributions were appreciated, the change in environment raised alarms. Gail Blackburn, a close acquaintance, noted his absence from his favorite social events. Clark was eventually traced by police at 10 East Cathcart Street, AB56 1PJ, relieved but concerned for his wellbeing after several days missing.
narrative=Damian Clark, last seen at a bingo hall, Rannes Street, before going off-grid. Police traced him via social media to North Road, Insch.

narrative=DAMIAN CLARK, a retired artist known for his active presence on social media, vanished from his residence at 37 North High Street, AB45 2PA. Before his disappearance, Damian frequently shared his art pieces and daily routines online, maintaining a consistent stream of updates. On the day he vanished, neighbors last saw him leaving his home around midday, and there were no unusual online activities indicating his plans. Reports suggested Damian was headed towards March Road, Buckie, AB56 1ER, but he never arrived at his known destinations. The sudden cessation of his online activity raised concerns. After a tense wait, police successfully located Damian on Bog Road, AB31 4JU, a few days later, bringing relief to his family and followers. Though disoriented, he was returned safely, with the reasons for his deviation remaining unclear.

narrative=Damian Clark was last seen leaving his residence at 37 North High Street, according to his sister. Concern grew when he failed to arrive at the park where he typically painted. The search extended to his former workplace at 10 East Cathcart Street, but yielded no leads. With time passing and anxiety mounting, his niece, Stephanie Blackburn, provided additional details about his frequent visits to a cemetery near Craigour Road, Torphins, AB31 4UE. Ultimately, Damian was found by staff on Carmelite Street, Banff, unharmed but in need of support, highlighting his susceptibility to disorientation due to his condition.

narrative=Dorian Clark was reportedly last seen by his sister as he prepared to leave his home at 37 North High Street. Known for his love of solitary walks and his regular visits to the dialysis center, concern arose when he did not return home as expected. Damian had expressed a desire to visit Gordon Crescent, AB34 5HJ, a place he often recollected with fondness from past gallery exhibitions. When his sister, after not hearing from him, contacted Shaun, Damian's secondary contact within his work circle, they collectively decided to alert local authorities. Police found Damian, in stable condition, on North Road, Insch, AB52 6XP. He had been disoriented, unable to recall the full details of his journey, and had inadvertently confused his intended destination.

narrative=Damian Clark, an 88-year-old retired artist, was last seen at his home on North High Street. Despite his sister's concerns about his wellbeing, Damian was known for living off-grid and often visited local spots alone. On the day he disappeared, he was believed to have headed toward a dock or marina near the workplace he used to frequent. Witnesses reported seeing an elderly man matching his description near a park along Bog Road, AB31 4JU. With familiarity in the area, Damian could have wandered further without alerting anyone. Fortunately, police located him in the early hours near Inchmarlo, unharmed. Although initially deemed high risk due to his age and disability, his condition was stable upon his return.

narrative=Damian Clark, an 88-year-old retired artist, was last known to frequent the docks at the marina near Beltie Road, AB31 4JT. Known for living a somewhat off-grid lifestyle, Damian often kept to himself, although he maintained an active presence on social media, posting his art and interacting with followers. In the days leading up to his disappearance, Damian had exhibited signs of suicidal ideation, which concerned his family, especially his sister. On the day he vanished, Damian had left behind cryptic messages online, prompting his family to alert authorities. Damian was found unhurt and reunited with his relieved family.
